cyclone.name: COLIN
cyclone.current_location: about 285 miles WSW of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Accelerating northeastward – landfall in the Florida Big Bend late Monday, then crossing Florida and Georgia and racing just offshore of the Carolinas before moving well east of the Mid-Atlantic toward the central Atlantic

weather_observation.watch_coast: None for the Mid-Atlantic; watches limited to portions of Florida and Georgia coast at this time
weather_observation.warning_coast: Indian Pass to Englewood, FL (Gulf side) and Sebastian Inlet, FL to South Santee River, SC (Atlantic side) under Tropical Storm Warning
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast, Florida Peninsula, southeastern Georgia, South Carolina and North Carolina coasts; outer-banks and near-shore Atlantic waters along the track
weather_observation.wind: Occasional northeast gusts 20–30 kt possible late Wednesday through Thursday as Colin passes well offshore
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor tidal departures (1–2 ft) possible around high tide, mainly along Delaware Bay entrances
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible in squally outer bands Wednesday night–Thursday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and elevated wave heights in approaches to the Delaware River shipping channel
